name: Hampton Inn Channel Islands Harbor

reviews.text: This brand new hotel opened in June 2007 and it was a little pricey (average of $170/night for a room in the 3rd floor overlooking the marina during the Labor Day Weekend), but it was well worth the price (since everything is new).
reviews.title: Great brand new hotel

likes.liked: — New, comfortable beds and pillows, balcony overlooking marina, free internet, free breakfast
likes.disliked: — Nothing much to do at the hotel itself...it's a place to get a good night sleep. Went to Santa Cruz Island to hike.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The had complimentary continental breakfast from 6 am to 10 am and one morning they had sausage patties, scrambled eggs, cereal, coffee, juices, fresh fruit salad, bagels, oatmeal, and more.
reviews.title: Recommend highly

reviews.text: The outdoor swimming pool is small, but nice to cool off. No jacuzzi. The beach is about 1/2 mile away and there's a little park with bbqs and tables right on the marina and adjacent to the hotel.
reviews.title: Agree With Previous Reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds were comfortable and the bathrooms were nice. Nothing super fancy, but nice. I posted a couple of outdoor pictures...
reviews.title: Best Hampton Inn!!!

reviews.text: This is the newest, nicest, & most classy Hampton Inn we have stayed in. .. We happened to arrive to watch sunset over Channel Island marina with the pleasure boats coming back into port -all from our room directly overlooking the marina. .What a pleasant relaxing surprise after dealing with southern Calif traffic all day.
reviews.title: Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel in September 2007. It was excellent. The check in was fast and very friendly. The room was large, very clean and had a balcony over looking the harbout. Lovely bathroom and a free breakfast completed our pleasure. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. There was a slight problem with no cups in the room for the morning coffee, but this was immediately rectified by the reception staff. You will not regret staying here.
reviews.title: Super Hotel - will stay again
No Complaints
reviews.text: Did not use the facilities, as we were only staying overnight. Hotel was clean as a whistle and still had that "new car smell" inside. Outside in the parking lot it smelled very fishy. The property is literally on the harbor. Didn't bother me, but I love the sea. The wife thought it was a bit overpowering but this was very late at night. I would highly recommend this property.

PROS: Every room has a balcony. It's a new lovely renovation of an old hotel (Casa Sirena) on the Channel Islands Marina. Everything was spotless. It was dead quiet at night and the marina view is lovely.
reviews.title: SPOTLESS & QUIET!

reviews.text: CONS: The mattress was harder than any other "Hampton Bed" I've slept in, partly because of the paper-thin pad which buckled up and the bottom sheet that was supposed to be fitted and was too large. The pillows were not the usual quality either. So, therefore I found the bed really uncomfortable. I think management will probably solve this eventually. I'd still stay there again and bring my own pillow and ask for a flat sheet to tuck in. Okay, it seems fussy, I know. However, I've stayed 50+ nights in hotels in the past year and value a comfortable bed, which is why I often choose Hampton Inns.
reviews.title: Good for business travel only
Brand new hotel with good service
reviews.text: This is a great stay if you are traveling for business. It didn't work as well for us as we were traveling for vacation and with children.

aka: Hampton Inn Channel Islands Harbor Hotel Oxnard
